body_html: Is there a way to call sccache --zero-stats before the build, and then call sccache --show-stats after the build so we can manually check and make sure cache hits are happening? I also noticed that there is report_compile_cache_stats function, but not sure if it is used by all the builds.
body_text: Is there a way to call sccache --zero-stats before the build, and then call sccache --show-stats after the build so we can manually check and make sure cache hits are happening? I also noticed that there is report_compile_cache_stats function, but not sure if it is used by all the builds.
body: Is there a way to call `sccache --zero-stats` before the build, and then call `sccache --show-stats` after the build so we can manually check and make sure cache hits are happening? I also noticed that there is `report_compile_cache_stats` function, but not sure if it is used by all the builds.
